data.title: Weekday Kid Activity
data.text: I brought my 4 year old here and spent a good 2 hours playing around.  There were so many hands on activities inside and a tiny zoo outside.  We loved that it was free and that it's part of the city all enclosed so your little one's don't exit.  It's best suitable for 6 and under but definitely best for about 2 to 4 year of age. If your kids are not in school yet, this is such a great place to take them.

data.title: Good
data.text: I'm au pair and I have visited this zoo/museum with my host children. It's a good place and it's free, not big animals but it's normal because it's free.

data.title: Great place or kids and adults.
data.text:
This s a city f Palo lot

This is a City of Palo Alto endeavor, and Palo Alto does a great job with all  of their recreation or learning facilities. I grew up in Palo alto and am familiar with most if it all. Junior Museum is well done for  smaller facility. It s right next door to the Community Center facilities which ncludes miming, tennis, play grounds and picnic and BB'Q AREAS.
I grew up in Palo Alto so I am familiar with most if not all of the parks and rec facilities. The museum is well done or it's size. The museum is part of what is called the Community Center facilities. This includes swimming pool. Tennis courts, playgrounds, picnic tables, BB'Q AREAS and community theatre for plays etc..

data.title: Great little place for little people !
data.text: This children's museum and mini zoo is meant for kids ages 0-9. They cater to the young ones and their parents with an intimate setting where kids can feel at home and explore to their heart's content.

data.title: Small, but wonderful zoo for children under 7 years old.
data.text: We went to the zoo with a 14 year old boy.  There were rides and a carousel and an indoor play area.  A lot of hands-on activities were inside.  Outdoors includes small enclosed areas of peacocks, turtles and other small animals.  Don't plan to be there more than 2 hours.  Great for children 206 years old.

data.title: Fun for toddlers
data.text: The Junior Museum has lots of hands-on science exhibits and a small number of animals on display. Kids up to about 8 have a great time!

data.title: Great For Toddlers
data.text:
I took my 13 month old to this for an afternoon and she loved the science museum. She is a bit young to understand the workings of the exhibits but none the less she was excited to be able to push buttons, turn wheels and see lights or water in motion.  The Zoo part is pretty small and most of the animals spent the whole afternoon sleeping. 

This place is great for toddlers, if you have slightly older kids Curiodyssey up at Coyote Point would probably be a better option.

data.title: Perfect for the Under-8 Crowd...
data.text: Toddlers and Young Children (up to 8 years old) will love the interactive indoor area of the museum. The Zoo outdoor area is in a confined space perfect for the under-8 crowd to explore. My six year-old loved this place and even after an hour wanted to stay longer. My older middle schooler was done with this place in 15 minutes. Lots of cute exhibits to take in - plenty of giggles watching the mice habitat. Staff was friendly. Parents tend to let their children do whatever they want here, so if your child likes to play with the interactive ball display cooperatively and a bunch of kids decide they are going to hide all the tennis balls elsewhere - you are out of luck. Kids parties keep it busy on the weekend and parking is tight in the lot even at opening time on a rainy Sunday morning.

data.title: Great little kid zoo/museum
data.text: Fun way to spend 2-3 hours with toddlers. They have nice group of outdoor zoo animals and a cute infant area. A few displays for older kids about solar and wind energy.

data.title: Cool
data.text: This place is nice for toddlers, good place to spend with there are a few animals, birds and some serpents.

data.title: Fun and Informative
data.text: Great place for kids. A wealth of learning. Be warned that schools visit at various times and it can get busy. A great place for the kids to have fun

data.title: Fun place for kids
data.text:
This is an experiential science center and zoo. The format is similar to Curiodyssey in San Mateo. The science is slanted towards to toddlers. For example, insect costumes and a large-scale web allows for some bug world role play. The ball maze is the highlight since all the kids want to stuff the tennis balls onto tracks and there is always  a chase for any escaped balls. Watch your littlest ones here, the big kids can be aggressive to get the balls.

The wildlife area is arranged to feel like natural landscape. All exhibits are accessible  and allow for the littlest ones to view the animals without hoist them up.

Admission is free, but donations are accepted.

There's a park with swings and slides along the side.

data.title: Great place for young kids.
data.text:
My four year old loved this place and kept him entertained for two hours. There were hands-on exhibits on different types of renewable energy that capture his interest. He also liked the ropes to climb on and the displays of all the insects. Even if it was rainy, you could spend at least an hour here. 

The little zoo outside also entertained him, particularly climbing the "tree" to be up close to some birds.

There is no charge for entry, just donations.

There is also a fun playground next door to the museum, so you can spend an entire afternoon here. 

I appreciated that they had vending machines with healthy snacks too!

data.title: What a FUN treasure in Palo Alto!
data.text: I took my 4 yr old grandson here for a fun outing while he was visiting me for the day. So enjoyable for us both. It is tucked away in the suburban center of Palo Alto on Middlefield Rd. If you have young children to entertain for a couple of hours this is a place worth seeking out. Approachable exhibits , lots of interesting animals, reptiles & insects to see up close and at a child's eye level. The also have lots of hands-on, interactive exhibits inside for kids to see & do. No risk of boredom when visiting this engaging place!

data.title: Small but excellent for young kids
data.text:
Adorable zoo with birds and reptiles. 
The place is small enough so its easy to watch the young kids, and not too crowded. 
A great activity for 1-2 hours.

Also, our kids really loved their summer camps.

data.title: Great for kids
data.text: No charge just donations (at least it used to be) and the kids love it. See little animals up close and learn about nature.

data.title: A very nice cosy and interesting place for young kids
data.text:
My 5 year old boy and my 16 month old girl were both happy there. It's small enough to make it easy to watch them both and has quite a few interesting things for them to do. While the little one just enjoyed carrying balls from place to place and walking around pressing every button she could reach, the older one was really interested in the scientific part of things and was also very happy to just run around. It's nice to be able to look at science in a fun and active way. It was great for him and great for me that the little one could have fun too.
They also have a small area closed for younger kids and babies. I didn't go in because I had to watch my older boy.

data.title: young kids's favorate
data.text: It is free and by donation basis.  There is a nice STEM/tech display and a small zoo with reptile, birds and bobcat.  You can easily spend half day there with young kids.  Great to have a birthday party in the Reconada park and kids can be entertained in the Junior museum.  Museum also offer many classes and camps for you kids.

data.title: Great spot
data.text: Great spot for your little guys to explore for a bit. The place is a little out dated and seems run down but it's alright.

data.title: Very nice place for the kids
data.text: Very cool place. Was here for the kids' birthday party with my 10 year old who loved it. They have a small zoo outside with different snakes, birds, but the bobcats are the hit. I'm sure we will be back.
